name: places/ChIJsXs-fHVZwokRxhcmT5IsJ2w

displayName.text: Mount Sinai Beth Israel Emergency Room

adrFormatAddress: 281 1st Ave., New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: Depending on the day hour week it's either fast or makes you wish you never came. Always the doctors have be very helpful and go the extra mile trying to help you. Once I was forgotten about and its my fault for not being assertive, I try to just be sick and not be one of those the place is sometimes full of. I've been going here for over three years sadly. Hope to never return.

originalText.text:
I have been to this hospital several times. I have never met a healthcare professional as compassionate as RN Jose Cabrera in the ER division. He is efficient, detail oriented, empathetic, just on top of his game.

MOUNT SINAI leadership, RN Jose is exceptional. He is an asset to your institution.

text.text:
I have been to this hospital several times. I have never met a healthcare professional as compassionate as RN Jose Cabrera in the ER division. He is efficient, detail oriented, empathetic, just on top of his game.

MOUNT SINAI leadership, RN Jose is exceptional. He is an asset to your institution.

originalText.text: I was abused here. I was having anxiety attacks from a severe episode of PTSD. Instead of caring for me with dignity I was I separated from my partner. I was violated by male security gaurds, and as a final humiliation two sacred articles of faith were taking from me. And to add insult to injury I was placed in a chair with no means to occupy my time. I was not given any medication to calm my anxiety. Trauma sufferers are not a threat and do not have the same needs as those with other psychological conditions. In top of that my worried partner was left in a hall and repeatedly asked to leave. This treatment is unacceptable

originalText.text: Came to the ER with my girlfriend. She couldn’t stand/control her body to get in her bed. The nurse who first assisted us asked for more help from Dawn, another nurse,  Dawn said, and I quote, “I’m not lifting no one.”  My girlfriend was unable to respond/control her body and the nurse seeing this chose to voice her annoyance rather than help. Dawn just looked at my girlfriend and walked off. luckily another male nurse saw our struggle and came to help. I’m giving it two stars because of him but overall the service was terrible. I had to advocate for her to use the bathroom, be provided water and medicine for her headache. She was mostly unresponsive there should have been a nurse frequently checking up on her. Think about the unresponsive patients with no advocates; how would they get help?

originalText.text: Dirty, extremely under staffed, rude and would not send my enemy to this place. They released my partially blind 83yr old grandmother with Alzheimer’s and dementia to take herself home at 10pm!!! They didn’t alert a single family member or even myself as her health care proxy! If I hadn’t decided to call to check up on her, I would’ve never know she was released. Her phone was dead, and I had to call 911 to file a police report to help locate my poor grandmother. Thankfully, a kind woman brought her all the way home safely while I was out searching the night for her. I could only imagine what would’ve happened if she was left alone on 1st Ave by herself in the state that it is in. Extremely negligent of the staff here!!!
